𓊅 bauen 𔑛𔒴 as verb:
Arabic بَنَى (banā) (بني (bny) root) : Hebrew בָּנָה (banah) [to posses, to build] with Sanskrit वनति (vanati) [to build, to make] : Avestan 𐬬𐬀𐬥𐬀𐬌𐬙𐬌 (vanaiti) [to establish, to make]

𒁀𒉡 ba-nu •bauen
𒁀𒉡 to create

𓊅 wohnen < *būwaną 𐌱𐌰𐌿𐌰𐌽 bauan, búa, bo *būaną. boun > wohn ⇔ being ⇔ leben > live

𓊅 *būwaną “to dwell, reside” from Proto-Indo-European *bʰúHt, from *bʰuH- “to become, grow, appear” be bear
būwaną (reanalyzed as bewohnen)

Wall ⇔ حيط ḥēṭ Hut 𓉗

O36 𓊅 bau/ba 𓊅 door ⇔ dorm/dome 𓊆 wall 𓊇𓊇𓊇 limit

PIE √bhedh- ‘to dig’ (a well-established root) buddel seabed Bad
IEW 113–14 *bhedh- ‘in die Erde stechen, graben’, Mallory–Adams 466
*bhedh- ‘to dig, burrow’ Cf. Gaulish bedo- ‘canal’.
Hurrian βilli, Urartian pili ‘canal’ (< *bhedh-li) (BGH 292)
Cf. Substratic Armenian պեղել peł-el ‘to dig’.
